oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photographs and captions from Miss Edith Scott's Memory Book, started July 1957. Her ancestors included the Scott, Deaderick, Crozier, Ramsey, Anderson and Alexander families. Francis Alexander Ramsey Scott (1827-1909) married Margaretta Frances Deaderick (1833-1909) in 1857. They were the parents of eleven children, including daughter Miss Edith Scott (1878-1971). Caption information appears below in the Full Text field.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We have just read that a Baptist church is the present owner of "Cedar Grove", but they abandoned it, for what reason I do not know, however, the vandals soon found the place was open for their destruction, and started in in dead earnest to destroy it, knocking out windows and doors and doing all the damage they knew how to do. But fortunately Mr., and Mrs. Stevens were looking for a place for a funeral home and saw the possibilities of "Cedar Grove" for that purpose. How glad I am that they bought it and on April 17, 1961 opened Stevens Mortuary. I am sure "Cedar Grove" was never prettier than it is today - up on a knoll in a grove of beautiful trees, with the creek flowing quietly at the foot of the knoll - accessible to Broadway, but far enough away to be very quiet. The interior is beautifully and tastefully furnished in every detail. There is where I want to be buried from not so very far away from where my marker is already placed in our family lot in "Old Gray Cemetery" - but of course all this is just if the Lord tarries.
